nodes.bodyText: This is then added via the picocli library, isn't it? I don't think we need to copy word-by-word, but just make sure that users can figure out what options/flags are available.
Does the Callabale move this to a different thread? Will this cause even more issues with porting to LWJGL 3 and MacOS (see #3969 )?

I don't think it runs it in another thread. I think picocli just uses Callable as an interface that's easy to define for use with its .execute(it) method, so it can run it, handle exceptions, and get a process return code at the end. But it'll be a good thing to double-check.
I confirmed this. currentThread() returns the same value inside the call method as it does in the static main.

I changed this from overrideDefaultConfig to simply config because I believed it was overriding the location of the default configuration file, and I thought that a config pointing to a file was clear enough for that.
but now I think this maybe specifies an additional config file that contains overrides. Not something used instead of the default config. If that's true, it should get its "override" name back.
This has been fixed and is available in picocli v4.5.2 - do we still need this workaround?

Correct, we can probably do without it now.
There are some edge cases involving what happens when you spell flags wrong, but going with the default behavior for that is a reasonable choice.
Yikes, this change wasn't intentional. How did that slip in there?
